response.original_title: Jazz is Alive, Jazz is Well, Jazz is in New York
response.overview: Oft-excerpted but rarely screened, this man-on-the-ground reportage made for French TV presents 1973 New York City as a hotbed of jazz, and divergent scenes. Duke Ellington is toasted with champagne and Charles Mingus feasts on Chinese food while Noah Howard rides the 1 train with his horn. Across town, Sun Ra and Sam Rivers burn in outdoor performances.
response.title: Jazz is Alive, Jazz is Well, Jazz is in New York
